item.title: A Future Of Gadgets Without Power Cords? Not So Fast
item.description: July 21, 2017 - This month, the first wireless-charging laptop hit the market. But making wireless power a standard consumer feature is a big technological — and psychological — challenge.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 21, 2017 - This month, the first wireless-charging laptop hit the market. But making wireless power a standard consumer feature is a big technological — and psychological — challenge. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/21/538531750/a-future-of-gadgets-without-power-cords-not-so-fast

item.title: Spotify Sued, Yet Again, Over Compositions
item.description:
July 21, 2017 - Two new lawsuits against the music streaming leader landed this week, over issues that have already twice led to settlements.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/07/21/538501163/spotify-sued-yet-again-over-compositions
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: How Did The Afghan All-Girl Team Do At The Robotics Competition?
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The Afghan team made headlines even before the event started when their visas were denied. But they made it after all!
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - The Afghan team made headlines even before the event started when their visas were denied. But they made it after all! http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/20/538379999/how-did-the-afghan-all-girl-team-do-at-the-robotics-competition

item.title: Justice Department Announces Seizure Of Dark Web Marketplace
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The Department of Justice announced Thursday its seizure of an international marketplace on the dark web. AlphaBay provided an anonymous site for people selling illegal drugs, firearms and other items.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - The Department of Justice announced Thursday its seizure of an international marketplace on the dark web. AlphaBay provided an anonymous site for people selling illegal drugs, firearms and other items. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538370711/justice-department-announces-seizure-of-dark-web-marketplace

item.title: In Rural Oregon, Efforts To Bring In Large Data Centers Raise Housing Costs
item.description: July 20, 2017 - In places like rural Oregon, politicians are working to bring in large data centers to town. It's great for folks who want good jobs but don't want to move away. But it's also raising housing costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - In places like rural Oregon, politicians are working to bring in large data centers to town. It's great for folks who want good jobs but don't want to move away. But it's also raising housing costs. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538370646/in-rural-oregon-efforts-to-bring-in-large-data-centers-raise-housing-costs

item.title: Justice Department Announces 'Largest Darknet Takedown In History'
item.description: July 20, 2017 - A joint operation by the department, the FBI and international law enforcement has shut down AlphaBay and Hansa, two of the world's largest anonymous marketplaces for illicit drugs and goods.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - A joint operation by the department, the FBI and international law enforcement has shut down AlphaBay and Hansa, two of the world's largest anonymous marketplaces for illicit drugs and goods. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/20/538309613/justice-department-announces-largest-darknet-takedown-in-history

item.title: Elon Musk Says He Has 'Verbal' OK To Build N.Y.-D.C. Hyperloop
item.description: July 20, 2017 - There's still much to do before getting formal approval, the entrepreneur adds. Hyperloop has the goal of reaching speeds of more than 700 mph, using magnetic levitation in a vacuum environment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - There's still much to do before getting formal approval, the entrepreneur adds. Hyperloop has the goal of reaching speeds of more than 700 mph, using magnetic levitation in a vacuum environment. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/20/538328487/elon-musk-says-he-has-verbal-ok-to-build-n-y-d-c-hyperloop

item.title: U.S. Ends Laptop Ban On Flights From Middle East
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The ban originally affected 10 airports and nine airlines, mostly Middle Eastern carriers. Meanwhile, the U.S. has issued additional security requirements affecting some 280 international airports.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - The ban originally affected 10 airports and nine airlines, mostly Middle Eastern carriers. Meanwhile, the U.S. has issued additional security requirements affecting some 280 international airports. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/20/538289182/u-s-ends-laptop-ban-on-flights-from-middle-east

item.title: Congress Struggles To Keep Up With Regulations For Self-Driving Cars
item.description: July 19, 2017 - Cars that drive themselves are a thing of the not-so-distant future. But Congress is having a hard time keeping up regulations to go with the technological change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - Cars that drive themselves are a thing of the not-so-distant future. But Congress is having a hard time keeping up regulations to go with the technological change. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/19/538148767/congress-struggles-to-keep-up-with-regulations-for-self-driving-cars

item.title: Getting Really Smart About Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
July 19, 2017 - AI isn't on the way … it's already here.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-19/getting-real-smart-about-artificial-intelligence
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Musk's Warning Sparks Call For Regulating Artificial Intelligence
item.description: July 19, 2017 - Elon Musk is warning that artificial intelligence is a "fundamental existential risk for human civilization." Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper is looking into how states can respond.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - Elon Musk is warning that artificial intelligence is a "fundamental existential risk for human civilization." Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper is looking into how states can respond. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/19/537961841/musks-warning-sparks-call-for-regulating-artificial-intelligence

item.title: The YouTube Star Who's Teaching Kids How To Bake
item.description: July 19, 2017 - Celebrity chef Rosanna Pansino hosts the YouTube show Nerdy Nummies and has more than 8 million subscribers. Among her fans are thousands of children who want to learn how to bake.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - Celebrity chef Rosanna Pansino hosts the YouTube show Nerdy Nummies and has more than 8 million subscribers. Among her fans are thousands of children who want to learn how to bake. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/19/537302223/the-youtube-star-whos-teaching-kids-how-to-bake

item.title: With Entry Into Interest Curation, Google Goes Head-To-Head With Facebook
item.description: July 19, 2017 - In the feed, users will get a stream of news, photos and more based on their search histories and interests across Google products. The company promises a different, less friend-filtered experience.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - In the feed, users will get a stream of news, photos and more based on their search histories and interests across Google products. The company promises a different, less friend-filtered experience. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/19/537960537/with-entry-into-interest-curation-google-goes-head-to-head-with-facebook

item.title: Tour Rio De Janeiro's Oldest Slave Port With This New App
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Rio de Janeiro was home to the Americas' largest slave port, which received nearly a million slaves over several centuries. Now modern day Cariocas have developed an app that provides an immersive tour through that history.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Rio de Janeiro was home to the Americas' largest slave port, which received nearly a million slaves over several centuries. Now modern day Cariocas have developed an app that provides an immersive tour through that history. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537948535/tour-rio-de-janeiros-oldest-slave-port-with-this-new-app

item.title: When Robot Face-Plants In Fountain, Onlookers Show Humanity — By Gloating
item.description: July 18, 2017 - The Knightscope K5 is a state-of-the-art machine, a patrol bot built to rove complexes in search of "unusual activity." But on Monday, it appeared to have a little trouble with stairs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - The Knightscope K5 is a state-of-the-art machine, a patrol bot built to rove complexes in search of "unusual activity." But on Monday, it appeared to have a little trouble with stairs. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/18/537905142/when-robot-face-plants-in-fountain-onlookers-show-humanity-by-gloating
